question.text:
Two identical narrow slits S1 and S2 are illuminated by the light of a wavelength λ  from a point source P.



If, as shown in the diagram above, the light is then allowed to fall on a screen, and if n is a positive integer, the condition for destructive interference at Q is

options.text: <math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>-</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mtext>n</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> <mi>λ</mi> <mo>/</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mo>-</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mtext>n</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> <mi>λ</mi> <mo>/</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>-</mo> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>n</mtext> <mi>λ</mi> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>-</mo> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mi>l</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mtext>n</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> <mi>λ</mi> <mo>/</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math>

solution.text:
Path difference = l⁡ 1 + l⁡ 3 - l⁡ 2 + l⁡ 4           ...(i)

for destructive interference

Path difference = 2 n + 1 λ / 2                   ...(ii)

l⁡ 1 + l⁡ 3 - l⁡ 2 + l⁡ 4 = 2 n + 1 λ / 2
